intro: Sloanea oligophlebia, commonly known as the narrow-veined sloanea, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. Sloanea oligophlebia is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
